svcproc.title: TRAILER BRAKE HOSE COUPLING AND DUMMY COUPLING

svcprocinfo.para: Hose couplings provide a convenient means for connecting and disconnecting air lines between tractors and trailers. When two couplings are joined, their packing rings are forced together under pressure to form an air tight seal.

Dummy coupling is the term given to those couplings which are used to keep dirt or foreign matter out of the air lines when they are not being used. Dummy couplings are either rigidly mounted to the truck or fastened by a chain.

svcsubproc.title: Service Checks
svcsubproc.para: With hose couplings connected and brakes applied, coat hose couplings with soap suds to check for leaks. There should be no leakage. Leakage results from worn, dam- aged, or improperly installed packing rings.

step1.para: At least once a year or when leakage is detected, the hose coupling should be disassembled, cleaned and serviced.
Remove old packing ring with a screwdriver. Be sure packing ring groove is thoroughly cleaned.

Work the remaining part of the packing ring into place with a blunt nosed (not sharp) screwdriver or similar tool ( Figure 117 ). Exposed face of packing ring will be flat and free of any bulges when properly installed.
